answer: Hoisting is the default JS behavior when all the var and function declarations are moved on top of their scope (global or local) without their value initialization.
In ES5 a new feature called Strict Mode allows to write code in a strict operational environment. It's much less error-prone since all forms of errors(including silent errors) will be thrown.
Event loop is a mechanism that allows non-blocking execution af async code in a single threaded environment.
